title: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve: Distance Learning
body: × Rate the Lesson Plan             Distance Learning Visit the Moon   Craters of the Moon National Monument & Preserve                  Overall Rating  Add your review    Visiting the Moon is an on-line activity that provides an opportunity for students to compare geologic features on Earth to similar features on other planetary bodies. Developed by an Idaho high school geology teacher in 2001 with the assistance of the Idaho Space Grant Consortium, the voice of NASA in Idaho.    How to Participate Click on the link to access: Visit the Moon     Details  Subject: Astronomy, Earth Science, Space Science National/State Standards: Grade 7: 1.2, 1.6Grade 8-9 PS: 1.2, 1.6Grade 8-9 ES: 1.2, 1.6 type: Distance Learning              Lesson Plans  Secrets of the Past   Geology Lesson 3. Where did the oceans go?   Habitats by Land and Sea: Restoring Resiliency    Distance Learning  Explore the Universe   Visiting Glacier Bay   Layers in Time     Field Trips  Earth Science Field Trip   Astronomy Program   Life on Sandy Shores    Topics  The Liberty Bell as a Modern Symbol, grades K-2   A Soldier's Notes From Michigan's Big Battle   Why Here?
